p.7: We are looking for a Data Analyst who=E2=80=99s able to leverage their technical data skills to help work efficiently between our business clients and our internal data engineers to produce effective and powerful data solutions.

li: Translate business data needs into technical specifications
li.1: Execute the define strategy as laid out by data and analytics leadership team
li.2: Analyze and investigate wide-ranging data sources looking for patterns, data quality, and specifics to help ensure the right data is used for the business need
li.3: Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
li.4: Ability to pivot on deliverables as priorities change
li.5: Evaluate and improve existing build processes
li.6: Develop queries and visualizations for ad-hoc requests and projects, as well as ongoing reporting
li.7: Generate project documentation and assist with Build-to-Run activities upon project closure
li.8: Use analytical and statistical rigor to solve complex problems and drive business decisions
li.9: Support automation of business processes to allow the team scale

li: 5+ years' experience as a BI engineer, data analyst, business analyst or statistical analyst analyzing large data sets, drawing insights, and communicating them to stakeholders to influence decision making
li.1: Intermediate skills in SQL and Python
li.2: Familiar with Agile processes, including use of Jira or Azure Dev Ops
li.3: Experience in ETL development, data warehousing, and AWS solutions
li.4: Excellent written and oral communication skills.
li.5: Experience building data products incrementally and integrating and managing datasets from multiple sources
li.6: Experience with ERP Systems, Data lakes, Data Marts
li.7: Experience working in a high-tech environment, comfortable navigating conflicting priorities and ambiguous problems
li.8: Ability to work on a diverse team or with a diverse range of coworkers
